SEARCH
Package io.github.thecsdev.tcdcommons.api.util.collections

Class IdealList<E>

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
io.github.thecsdev.tcdcommons.api.util.collections.IdealList<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<E>, Collection<E>, List<E>, SequencedCollection<E>
public class IdealList<E> extends AbstractList<E> implements Iterable<E>
Tired of built-in list types that never have the one thing you need?
Well fear not, for this one has everything that I will ever need!

Features:

  • Resilient to ConcurrentModificationException
  • Iterator capable of handling complex concurrent changes
  • Features find(Predicate)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    protected final class 
    IdealList.IdealListIterator
    A ListIterator implementation for IdealList.
    protected final class 
    IdealList.Node
    An IdealList node that works similarly to how linked-list nodes work.
    Tracks the next and previous nodes for a given IdealList entry.

      public final E find(Predicate<E> predicate)
      Returns the first containing element that matches a given Predicate, or null if such an element is not in this IdealList.

      Throws:

    • forEachNode

      protected final void forEachNode(Consumer<IdealList<E>.Node> action)
      Iterates over all IdealList<E>.Nodes in the __nodes list, and performs an action for each of them.
      Parameters:
      action - The action to perform.

    • findNode

      protected final Map.Entry<Integer,IdealList<E>.Node> findNode(Function<IdealList<E>.Node,Boolean> action)
      Finds a IdealList<E>.Node in the __nodes list, that matches a given predicate.
      Parameters:
      action - The predicate. Return true from the predicate to return the IdealList<E>.Node.
      Returns:
      A Map.Entry containing the IdealList<E>.Node and its index number. The returned index number will be -1 if a IdealList<E>.Node was not found.

    • getFirstNode

      @Nullable protected final IdealList<E>.@Nullable Node getFirstNode()
      Returns the first IdealList<E>.Node in the __nodes list.

    • getLastNode

      @Nullable protected final IdealList<E>.@Nullable Node getLastNode()
